fields.summary: Incorrect result when hive.groupby.skewindata is enabled

comments.body: I have verified that it works fine when I pass a constant seed value while calling the rand function for random partitioning. Please review the patch.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12933771 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Please help with adding the concerned folks to review this fix. 

Cc: [~ashutoshc] [~thejas] [~jcamachorodriguez]
Is there a reason for config? I think deterministic rand() is always useful. So, perhaps we can get rid of config and always do this.
[~ashutoshc] I just wanted to make sure that things are fine if we use deterministic rand, so added it under a config. I'll make the changes to always call rand function with seed.
[~ashutoshc] Please review the updated patch.

A deterministic rand() only works if there's no partial group-by above it (the retries don't return the rows in the same order, because for loops over HashMap).

So you'd have to make sure these keys are not partial aggregated before the RAND() is applied.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12935173 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~gopalv] I believe the hash mode aggregation can happen in mappers when map side aggregation (hive.map.aggr) is enabled.

Can we change the HashMap to LinkeHashMap at [this line|https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/GroupByOperator.java#L383] to maintain the order of keys?

 

Please let me know if I need to check for partial aggregation in any other place.
This issue can unknowingly lead to data loss or inconsistency as explained in the description. I would appreciate if someone can help with reviewing the fix.
To add to Ganesha's point above, this is an issue with both Tez and MR. So this is a very pertinent issue.
